thread.title: EastEnders spoilers: There's love in the air for the Beales – but no romance for Whitney and Lee
thread.title_full: EastEnders spoilers: There's love in the air for the Beales – but no romance for Whitney and Lee

author: Claire Murphy
title: EastEnders spoilers: There's love in the air for the Beales – but no romance for Whitney and Lee
text:
Ian gives Jane an unexpected card (Photo: BBC) Share Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
He might not be the world’s most romantic husband, but at least Ian’s practical. 
He presents Jane with an early Valentine’s Day card and a gift. Let’s just say it’s not chocolates or flowers but his heart was in the right place. 
Meanwhile, Bex is delighted to receive a card from Shakil. And Stacey and Martin have a rare date night together after Michelle offers to babysit. Martin and Stacey enjoy their date night (Photo: BBC) 
She’s another surprised and intrigued recipient of a Valentine’s card – and something else besides. Jack gets dead angry Jack, Max and Billy (Photo: BBC) Read More EastEnders reveals what really caused Ronnie and Roxie's death - and Jack Branning is furious 
Leave it Jack, it ain’t worth it! It may be Valentine’s but there’s nothing loving about the row that kicks off between the widower and Billy. 
It starts because Jack makes a request to the undertaker that he doesn’t approve of – and Billy tells him so. Luckily, Max intervenes before things escalate even further, and once again it’s Max who looks like the good guy as he offers his brother some well-meaning advice. He’s lone Lee Lee and Whitney's marriage reaches breaking point (Photo: BBC) 
They’ve tried again and again to make their marriage a success. 
But even the most optimistic person would admit that Lee and Whitney just aren’t suited. 
After a disastrous February 14 and a chat with his dad Mick, Lee realises that it’s the end of the road for the couple and he’d be better off alone.
